conbody.p: hosts in a high-availability deployment have the following requirements.

ul.li: Master host: In a separate resource pool, you need two identical hosts in the role of master host; one host serves as the primary node and the other as the secondary node.

Delegate hosts: You need two or more identical hosts to serve as delegate hosts. They do not need to be members of the HA cluster because, if a host becomes unavailable, restarts services on other hosts.
Each resource pool requires N+1 hosts, where N is the number of delegate hosts needed to satisfy the performance and scalability requirements of the pool.
For primary and secondary nodes that contain only one network-interface card (NIC), the network they use to communicate must support multicast.
